column4: I've searched and searched for codecs that lets me play 3gp files (video recordings from mobile phones) on my Ubuntu machine, without luck. It'll only play the video part. Not the sound. Can anyone help?
have you installed the non_free_codecs from medibuntu.org ?
Thanks. There were 2 AMR codecs there, installed now, but apparently not the ones needed.
funny i have no problems with 3gp neither in mplayer/totem nor in vlc just installed the nonfree from medibuntu do u use 32 or 64 bit?
